intro: Sida pedata, commonly known as the Mexican morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its delicate, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of blue, purple, and white. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and grows as an annual herb, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Sida pedata is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes other plants like hibiscus and cotton. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, contributing to its spread in various habitats.
